other

Class Screen

  • java.lang.Object
    • other.Screen

  • public class Screen
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the screen that shows up primarily, as dependent on how user progresses through game
    Author:
    Rithvik

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Screen()
      Creates a new screen object

    • Method Detail

      • drawStartMenu

        public void drawStartMenu(processing.core.PApplet marker,
                          processing.core.PImage g,
                          int mouseX,
                          int mouseY)
        Creates the start menu, the menu that first appears to the user. Allows progressing to next menus.
        Parameters:
        marker - allows PApplet access
        g - the image that will be used as the background for the start screen
        mouseX - the current x position of user mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of user mouse

      • drawHeroMenu

        public void drawHeroMenu(processing.core.PApplet marker,
                         java.util.ArrayList<processing.core.PImage> images,
                         int mouseX,
                         int mouseY)
        Creates a menu that allows the user to choose a hero. Allows going back to the start screen, going to settings menu, and going to the chooseGamePlay Screen if hero is picked
        Parameters:
        marker - allows PApplet access
        images - the array of images that will be used for the hero sprites
        mouseX - the current x position of user mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of user mouse

        public void screenSifter(processing.core.PApplet marker,
                         java.util.ArrayList<processing.core.PImage> images,
                         int mouseX,
                         int mouseY)
        Toggles between screens to decide when to appropriately display which screen
        Parameters:
        marker - allows PApplet access
        images - the images used as backgrounds or hero sprites in the game screens
        mouseX - the current x position of the user mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the user mouse

      • hover

        public void hover(java.awt.Rectangle rect,
                  processing.core.PShape shape,
                  int mouseX,
                  int mouseY,
                  int color1,
                  int color2)
        Creates a hover effect when user's mouse is over a button
        Parameters:
        rect - represents the button in question
        shape - represents the button itself
        color1 - the color of the button when the user's mouse is not over the button
        color2 - the color of the button when the user's mouse is over the button
        mouseX - the current x position of the user's mouse
        mouseY - the current x position of the user's mouse

        Parameters:
        mouseX - the current x position of the user's mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the user's mouse
        pmouseX - the previous x position of the user's mouse
        pmouseY - the previouse y position of the user's mouse

        Parameters:

        Calculates the volume of the sound
        Returns:

        Returns:

        public boolean getIsSoundOn()

        Returns:
